Package gov.nist.timestampingauthority

Class TimeStampingAuthority

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.timestampingauthority.TimeStampingAuthority
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TimeStampingAuthorityServer 
    public class TimeStampingAuthority
extends java.lang.Object
    The TimeStampingAuthority class uses NTP to communicate with clock servers. NTP is an extension of UDP protocol, so this server uses UDP classes and commands under the hood. When the class is run, it creates Clock classes with addresses from the file and makes them synchronize with corresponding time servers periodically. Each clock class updates time using a separate thread.

    All clocks are assumed to operate on port 123. If the file with clock addresses could not be opened, the execution is aborted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeStampingAuthority

        public TimeStampingAuthority​(java.lang.Long updateInterval,
                             java.lang.Integer timeout,
                             java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                             java.lang.Boolean spreadOutClocks)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Create TimeStampingAuthority, initialize the clocks. You can provide null instead of an argument to use default value. If one of the clock addresses could not be found, the clock is ignored and the message is printed into System.out.
        Parameters:
        updateInterval - interval for clock update, default is 10000 ms (10 seconds), must be a positive integer in ms. Values over 5000 ms are recommended due to clock server restrictions.
        timeout - time to wait for clock response, default is 500 ms, must be a positive integer in ms. Values over 100 ms are recommended, due to network latency.
        filePath - path to a file where the clock addresses are stored, must be a path to a readable file containing clock addresses. This file must have the following format: each line must either contain the NTP server address or start with % to indicate a comment. Empty lines are permitted as well. Invalid or unreachable addresses are ignored. If no working clocks were found, the server is stopped. Please note that if the text file was created with Notepad on Windows it might have some special characters in the beginning of the file that may hinder the file reading (something connected to UTF-8 with BOM). It is advised that you make sure the file does not start with anything but spaces, actual server address or a percentage character (%).
        spreadOutClocks - whether the clocks are to be spread out to reduce the network load, e.g. if there are 10 clocks and update interval is 1000, 1st clock starts at 0ms, 2nd at 100ms, etc. If set to false, all clocks start updating simultaneously.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when one of the arguments is invalid or when none of the clocks has a valid address
        java.io.IOException - when the file could not be opened

    • Method Detail

      • loadClocks

        public void loadClocks()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Read clock addresses from the file and initialize Clock classes with the data read. Can only be called when the TsA is not running.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the file could not be read
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when called while the TsA is running

      • getUpdateInterval

        public long getUpdateInterval()
        Get clock update interval.
        Returns:
        clock update interval

      • setUpdateInterval

        public void setUpdateInterval​(long updateInterval)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set and validate clock update interval. Will only be updated when the server is restarted.
        Parameters:
        updateInterval - clock update interval
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when update interval is not a positive integer

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Get clock timeout.
        Returns:
        clock timeout

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout​(java.lang.Integer timeout)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set and validate clock timeout. Will only be updated when the server is restarted.
        Parameters:
        timeout - clock timeout
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when timeout is not a positive integer

      • getFilePath

        public java.nio.file.Path getFilePath()
        Get clocks file path.
        Returns:
        clocks file path

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath​(java.nio.file.Path filePath)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set and validate clocks file path. Will only be used when loadClocks() method is called.
        Parameters:
        filePath - clocks file path
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the file path is not pointing to a file

      • isSpreadOutClocks

        public boolean isSpreadOutClocks()
        Tell if the clocks are to be spread out to reduce the network load, e.g. if there are 10 clocks and update interval is 1000, 1st clock starts at 0ms, 2nd at 100ms, etc. If set to false, all clocks start updating simultaneously.
        Returns:
        whether the clocks are to be spread out in update interval

      • setSpreadOutClocks

        public void setSpreadOutClocks​(boolean spreadOutClocks)
        Set flag if the clocks are to be spread out to reduce the network load, e.g. if there are 10 clocks and update interval is 1000, 1st clock starts at 0ms, 2nd at 100ms, etc. If set to false, all clocks start updating simultaneously. Will only be updated when the server is restarted.
        Parameters:
        spreadOutClocks - whether the clocks are to be spread out in update interval

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Return state of whether the server is running.
        Returns:
        true if server is running

      • isTimeAvailable

        public boolean isTimeAvailable()
        Check if accurate time available from the TsA. Time is not available if none of the clocks could be reached. The state can theoretically change after the call if other thread tries to reach the available clocks and fails.
        Returns:
        if time is available

      • getAccurateClockCount

        public int getAccurateClockCount()
        Number of synchronized clocks at the moment. The state can theoretically change after the call if other thread tries to reach the available clocks and fails.
        Returns:
        number of synchronized clocks

      • getAggregateTime

        public java.lang.Long getAggregateTime()
        Request aggregate time from the clocks in ms. Currently returns the average time. Returns null if no clocks were used because none were synchronized at the moment of request.
        Returns:
        aggregate time from clocks in ms or null if no clocks are synchronized

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Start clock synchronization. You might need to wait some time between calling start() and getAggregateTime(), because some time is needed to reach the clocks over the network. Use isTimeAvailable() to check if the time can be queried now. This method is non-blocking.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the server failed to connect to the socket.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the TsA is already running

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop clock synchronization.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the TsA is already stopped
